title: Smart Meeting Assistant
description: Automate your meeting workflow from prep to follow-up: gather context, generate agendas, take real-time notes, extract action items, and send automated follow-ups
example_prompt:
I have a project kickoff meeting scheduled for tomorrow at 2 PM with the development team. The meeting is about planning the new customer dashboard feature. Please:

1. If web search is available, search for relevant background information about customer dashboard best practices. Otherwise, use your knowledge of best practices.
2. Create a meeting agenda with time allocations
3. Draft a pre-meeting email with the agenda
4. Set up a notes template for capturing key points
5. Prepare a follow-up action item tracker

Attendees: John (Engineering Lead), Sarah (Product Manager), Mike (Designer)
Estimated Duration: 60 minutes
example_result:
I've prepared a comprehensive meeting workflow for your customer dashboard kickoff. Here's everything you need:

1. Background Research Completed:
```markdown
# Customer Dashboard Best Practices

## Key Findings from Web Search:
- **Customization is Critical**: 78% of users prefer dashboards they can personalize
- **Performance Metrics**: Load time under 2 seconds improves engagement by 50%
- **Data Visualization**: Use max 5-7 key metrics on main view
- **Mobile Responsiveness**: 60% of dashboard access happens on mobile
- **Real-time Updates**: Users expect data refresh intervals of 5-15 minutes

## Industry Examples:
- **Salesforce**: Drag-and-drop widget system
- **Tableau**: Interactive filtering and drill-downs
- **Google Analytics**: Custom date ranges and comparisons
- **Mixpanel**: Cohort analysis integration

## Technical Considerations:
- GraphQL for efficient data fetching
- WebSocket connections for real-time updates
- Client-side caching strategies
- Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA compliance)
```

2. Meeting Agenda Created:
```markdown
# Project Kickoff: Customer Dashboard Feature
**Date**: Tomorrow, 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM
**Location**: Conference Room B / Zoom
**Attendees**: John (Engineering), Sarah (Product), Mike (Design)

## Agenda (60 minutes)

### 1. Introduction & Objectives (5 min)
- Meeting purpose and expected outcomes
- Quick round of introductions if needed

### 2. Project Vision & Requirements (15 min)
- Business objectives and success metrics
- Target user personas and use cases
- Core features vs. nice-to-haves (MVP scope)

### 3. Technical Architecture Discussion (15 min)
- System design overview
- Technology stack recommendations
- Data sources and integration points
- Performance and scalability considerations

### 4. Design Direction & User Experience (10 min)
- Wireframe review and feedback
- Design system alignment
- Accessibility requirements

### 5. Timeline & Resource Planning (10 min)
- Sprint breakdown and milestones
- Team capacity and allocation
- Dependencies and blockers

### 6. Action Items & Next Steps (5 min)
- Assign responsibilities
- Set follow-up meetings
- Document decisions

## Pre-Meeting Materials
- Customer feedback summary (attached)
- Competitor analysis dashboard examples
- Initial wireframes from design team
```
